pullRequest.body:
For a `V`-category `C`, define the opposite `V`-category as an instance on the type `Cᵒᵖ`, construct an equivalence between the underlying category `ForgetEnrichment V (Cᵒᵖ)` and the opposite category `(ForgetEnrichment V C)ᵒᵖ`, and construct an instance of `EnrichedOrdinaryCategory V (Cᵒᵖ)` in the case that `C` comes with an instance of `EnrichedOrdinaryCategory V C`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Any comments and/or suggestions are greatly appreciated! In particular, I don't know whether it's best to construct the `V`-category structure on `Cᵒᵖ` as done here, or to introduce a new underlying type instead. The current implementation is chosen so that we may immediately define the `EnrichedOrdinaryCategory` instance, but I am happy to re-write and/or re-organize if this is not preferred.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [b753692660](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19483/commits/b753692660d9187f1b23adb6c0d64f042eee25fb)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Enriched.Opposite` (new file)|594|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ EnrichedCategory.opposite`
`+ EnrichedOrdinaryCategory.opposite`
`+ eComp_op_eq`
`+ forgetEnrichmentOppositeEquivalence`
`+ forgetEnrichmentOppositeEquivalence.functor`
`+ forgetEnrichmentOppositeEquivalence.inverse`
`+ tensorHom_eComp_op_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This instance is inferred automatically by design:
```suggestion
```

When constructing isomorphisms, you may use `NatIso.ofComponents`, which requires checking the naturality only in one direction, which can be achieved automatically here:
```suggestion
@[simps]
def forgetEnrichmentOppositeEquivalence :
    ForgetEnrichment V Cᵒᵖ ≌ (ForgetEnrichment V C)ᵒᵖ where
  functor := ForgetEnrichment.Opposite.toOp V C
  inverse := ForgetEnrichment.Opposite.fromOp V C
  unitIso := NatIso.ofComponents (fun _ ↦ Iso.refl _)
  counitIso := NatIso.ofComponents (fun _ ↦ Iso.refl _)
```
Also, `Equivalence.mk` is not recommended (unless we are only interested in the existence of an abstract equivalence), because that constructor does not require the additional compatibility `functor_unitIso_comp` (which is obtained automatically here!) which is also satisfied by adjunction and changes one of the isos in order to get this additional compatibility.
I would suggest using the name `forgetEnrichmentOppositeEquivalence`, and renaming `ForgetEnrichment.Opposite.toOp` as `forgetEnrichmentOppositeEquivalence.functor` and `fromOp` as `forgetEnrichmentOppositeEquivalence.inverse`.
I believe this would be better placed in the docstring of the file above.

Capital initials are used only for types:
```suggestion
instance EnrichedCategory.opposite : EnrichedCategory V Cᵒᵖ where
```

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Enriched/Opposite): the opposite category of an enriched category
